description: Patterns for recreating designs from screenshots, descriptions, and references

screenshot_analysis.description: Systematic approach to converting a screenshot/image into code

steps.name: Identify Layout Structure
steps.output: Layout skeleton: e.g., 'fixed sidebar 240px + scrollable main, topbar 56px, content padded 24px'

steps.name: Extract Color Palette
what_to_look_for: Background color (is it pure black, dark gray, off-white?)

steps.name: Identify Typography
what_to_look_for: Heading font (serif vs sans-serif, geometric vs humanist)
Font sizes (hero heading, section headings, body, small text)

font_identification_clues.geometric_sans: Perfectly round O, uniform stroke width → Inter, DM Sans, Outfit
font_identification_clues.grotesque_sans: Slightly squared, technical feel → Space Grotesk, Sora
font_identification_clues.humanist_sans: Slight organic curves, warm → Source Sans, Commissioner
font_identification_clues.modern_serif: High contrast, sharp serifs → Playfair Display, Cormorant
font_identification_clues.monospace: Fixed width, code-like → JetBrains Mono, Fira Code
font_identification_clues.rounded_sans: Soft, friendly terminals → Nunito, Outfit, Plus Jakarta Sans

steps.name: Identify Components
steps.output: Component list with style notes for each

steps.name: Identify Interactions & Effects
what_to_look_for: Hover effects on cards (lift? glow? border change?)
steps.output: CSS transitions and animations to implement

clone_website_approach.description: How to recreate an existing website from a URL or description
rules: NEVER copy content verbatim — use placeholder content that matches the structure
Match the DESIGN SYSTEM (colors, fonts, spacing) not pixel-perfect layout
Identify the 5-6 key design decisions that define the site's look
Simplify overly complex JS interactions into CSS where possible
process: 1. Note the overall vibe (minimal? bold? corporate? playful?)
2. Extract the color palette (3-5 key colors)
4. Map out the section structure top to bottom
5. Identify the 3 most distinctive design elements
6. Build from top to bottom: nav → hero → sections → footer

key_elements: Very refined typography with tight letter-spacing
stripe_style.palette: Dark navy (#0a2540) with cyan/purple gradients, white text

linear_style.palette: Near-black (#0a0a0a) with purple/blue accent, minimal color

vercel_style.palette: Pure black (#000) and white, minimal accent color
vercel_style.fonts: Inter, with monospace for code elements

notion_style.palette: Light (#ffffff bg, soft grays) with colorful accent spots

key_elements: Full-viewport hero stack — one product per screen
Alternating pure black (#000) and white (#fff) sections
System font stack (-apple-system) — zero font loading
Minimal copy: 3-5 words per product headline
Text link CTAs (Learn more › / Buy ›) not buttons
apple_style.palette: Binary: pure #000 and #fff backgrounds only. Text: #1d1d1f on white, #f5f5f7 on black. Links: #2997ff (Apple blue). Muted: #86868b
apple_style.fonts: SF Pro / -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont system stack. No external fonts.
apple_style.layout: nav(44px sticky) → hero1(100vh, dark) → hero2(100vh, light) → 2-up-grid(rounded cards) → 2-up-grid → footer

key_elements: Hero carousel with 3-5 auto-rotating promotional slides
Category grid with product thumbnails and starting prices
Deal cards with strikethrough prices and savings badges
Branded promo banner with gradient background
Sale urgency: red badges, countdown timers, percent-off callouts
hp_ecommerce_style.palette: White (#fff) dominant. Brand blue (#0096d6) accent. Sale red (#c00). Text: #1a1a1a primary, #555 secondary. Cards: #f9f9f9 bg with #eee borders.
hp_ecommerce_style.fonts: System sans-serif stack or brand proprietary. Modest heading sizes (24-36px).
hp_ecommerce_style.layout: mega-nav(sticky 2-row) → carousel(400px, auto-play) → category-grid(4 cols) → deals-grid(3 cols with prices) → promo-banner(gradient) → footer(4-col grid)

mapping.frame_fill: Fixed: width: {n}px; Hug: width: fit-content; Fill: width: 100% / flex: 1;
mapping.effects_blur: backdrop-filter: blur({n}px); (layer blur) or filter: blur({n}px); (background blur)
mapping.text_styles: font-family; font-size; font-weight; line-height; letter-spacing; text-align;
mapping.constraints: Fixed positioning or percentage-based responsive layout
mapping.component_variants: CSS classes or data attributes for different states

common_figma_to_css_mistakes: Figma uses absolute positioning by default — convert to flex/grid for responsive
Figma 'Fill container' = flex: 1 or width: 100%, not a fixed pixel width
Figma border radius on components may need overflow: hidden on parent
Figma auto-layout gap is CSS gap property, not margin between children
Figma text line-height is often percentage (140%) — convert to unitless (1.4) or pixels
Figma blur effects: 'Layer blur' = filter:blur(), 'Background blur' = backdrop-filter:blur()

visual_pattern_recognition.description: Common visual patterns and how to implement them

patterns.bento_grid: CSS Grid with varying span sizes: grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr); then specific items get grid-column: span 2; or grid-row: span 2;
patterns.masonry: CSS columns: column-count: 3; column-gap: 16px; .item { break-inside: avoid; margin-bottom: 16px; }
patterns.gradient_border: background: linear-gradient(var(--bg), var(--bg)) padding-box, linear-gradient(135deg, #6366f1, #a78bfa) border-box; border: 1px solid transparent; border-radius: 12px;
patterns.spotlight_glow: position: relative; &::before { content: ''; position: absolute; inset: -1px; background: conic-gradient(from var(--angle), transparent, var(--primary), transparent); border-radius: inherit; z-index: -1; filter: blur(20px); }
patterns.frosted_glass: background: rgba(255,255,255,0.05); backdrop-filter: blur(24px) saturate(180%); -webkit-backdrop-filter: blur(24px) saturate(180%); border: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.08);
patterns.animated_gradient_bg: background: linear-gradient(-45deg, #0a0a0f, #1a1040, #0a2030, #0a0a0f); background-size: 400% 400%; animation: gradientShift 15s ease infinite;
patterns.parallax_section: background-attachment: fixed; background-position: center; background-size: cover;
patterns.scroll_reveal: IntersectionObserver with threshold 0.1, adds .visible class that transitions opacity and transform
